Posts.Content: Hi Joeven Thanks for the reply. You no doubt had a mountain to climb...but things are working out for you looks like.....good PSA! NO ALCOHOL!!!!! Heck are you sure you are British? That would do my head in! Regards
Posts.Title: PSA During Hormone Treatment

Posts.Content: Hi Folks First time posting here (visit often)...nevertheless I would like to hear from other guys with similar outcomes. Just got another PSA result today...<0.1 again. Finished my RT 5 months ago (37 sessions) and my PSA has been Undetectable for the past 8 months...it was undetectable before I started RT. I'm still on Zoladex (and will be for the next 2 1/2 years) & Enzalutamide (and will be for the next 6 months). It would be interesting to hear from other guys that went through HT+RT (remember I still have my Prostate) with similar Gleason and Original PSA..and your outcome. It is not to difficult to find other guys that are members of the "Zero Club"....but they all had their Prostate out. Regards ************* Age: 54 Diagnosed: Nov 2015 PSA: 15/11/2015 52.6 04/02/2016 24.0 08/03/2026 20.3 25/04/2016 1.6 09/05/2016 0.8 02/06/2016 0.3 20/07/2016 0.1 30/08/2016 <0.1 17/11/2016 <0.1 31/01/2017 <0.1 24/04/2017 <0.1 Gleason: 4+3 on 35% and 4+4 on 30% CT/Bone Scan/MRI: Localised...No Metastasis (T3aN0M0) HT: Started Jan 1st 2016...Zoladex and Xtandi (enzalutamide) RT: Scheduled for Sept 2016...ENDING 37 sessions November 22, 2016
Posts.Title: PSA During Hormone Treatment

Posts.Content: Hi Jim You got good numbers there! Your initial PSA was "relatively" low to begin with.....Where you offered RP instead of RT/Brachy? Interesting to see someone treated with just Brachy+RT and no HT whatsoever! Regards
